name: stackql
description: SQL interface for arbitrary resources with full CRUD support

repo.name: stackql
repo.description: Query, provision and operate Cloud and SaaS resources and APIs using an extensible SQL based framework

readme.summary: The documentation is thorough but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
readme.top_issue: Lack of a concise quick start example to get new users started with the package.

injection_risks.description: The ExecQuery function executes a SQL query with user-provided input without proper sanitization, which can lead to SQL injection attacks.
The ValidateQuery function executes a SQL query with user-provided input without proper sanitization, which can lead to SQL injection attacks.

critical_findings: SQL injection vulnerabilities in the ExecQuery and ValidateQuery functions
Lack of input validation for user-provided data
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including SQL injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which can lead to serious security breaches.

common_complaints: open issues with no comments or responses
sentiment.summary: The community health is neutral, with open issues and a lack of engagement from maintainers.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally helpful and clear, showing patience with new contributors and a good level of technical depth.

concerns: High number of open issues (114) compared to merged PRs in the past 6 months (45)
No active pull requests, indicating potential lack of community contribution
positive_signals: Recent commit activity within the last year
Regular release schedule with a new release in December 2025
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance efforts with recent commits and releases but faces challenges with unresolved issues.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, indicating high bus factor risk.
